title: 820-3115 no cpu vcore
message:
Hi guys,
having a 820-3115 board, powers on, green light and all power rails are there except CPU VCORE.

the board got liquid spilled around the SMC area and U3890. U7400 area looks totally fine.

so checked : 
CPU_PWRGD =1V ALL_SYS_PWRGD = 3 V

u7400:  pin 46,29,19=5v  TONA, TONB= around 1v   pin47 VR_ON=3.3V

all voltages should fullfill already, not sure why there is no CPU VCORE still

we encountered case like this before and replaced U7400 and mosfets without success, so this time I didn't touch them yet. highly believe they should fine since they look absolutely good clean condition under microscope.checked around the short to ground on ALL pins, don't find any suspicious ones

M I missing something?any thoughts please?

thank you!

title: 820-3115 no cpu vcore
message: And I actually replaced a new SMC already, since that's the spilled area and I doubted bad SMC or crap under it. but still the same thing after replacement

title: 820-3115 no cpu vcore
message:
Check actual resistance of R7402/03, not on the resistor but from PPBUS to the pin on U7400 to rule out bad traces.
If those are fine it could be anything, the CPU talks to U7400 to set the voltage. Could be dead PCH/CPU, corroded trace/resistor.....anything.

title: 820-3115 no cpu vcore
message: Checked resistors as suggested, all fine.. damn, having a feeling it's the PCH got corroded.

title: 820-3115 no cpu vcore
message: Give it some flux and heat. Clock chip may also be suspect

title: 820-3115 no cpu vcore
message:
clock chip would cause the CPU vcore problem too?I thought the board powers on already and that would mean it's fine.
I heated the PCH with flux...no luck , probably will try replacing the PCH and take it off and see how under it looks like
